entry.def: depleted [movement in the vessels]; depletion; hollow; false

sense.def: ① Alternative Names ti xu 體虛 , body depletion. Pathological Mechanism of a depletion of the proper qi of the human body, with a diminution of physiological functions and a decrease of the organism’s defense potential. Su wen 素問 10: 是謂五並，虛而相併者也 , “These are the so-called ‘five accumulations.’ In the case of a depletion mutual accumulations occur”.

② Alternative Names xu bing 虛病 , depletion disease; xu ji 虛疾 , depletion ailment; xu zheng 虛證 , depletion condition; xu ruo 虛弱 , depletion and weakness; xu lei 虛羸 , depletion and thinness. Pathological Condition of all types of a depleted and weak condition brought forth by xu 虛①, depletion. Su wen 素問 20: 實則瀉之，虛則補之 , “In case of repletion, drain it. In case of depletion , supplement it”. As the nature of the items depleted varies, there are also qi xu 氣虛 , qi depletion; xue xu 血虛 , blood depletion; yang xu 陽虛 yang [qi] depletion; yin xu 陰虛 , yin [qi] depletion., as well as conditions of depletion associated with individual depots and palaces. ③ Alternative Names ti xu 體虛 , hollow body;; nei xu 內虛 , hollow interior; xin xu 心虛 , hollow center..Pharmaceutical substances of a loose or hollow structure. Ben cao jing ji zhu 本草經集注 preface: 以藥升分之者，謂藥有虛實、輕重，不得用斤兩，則以昇平之 , “To measure [pharmaceutical drugs] with a ‘pharmaceutical bushel’ has the following rationale: some drugs are hollow , others not; some are light, others are heavy – they cannot be measured on the basis of their weight. They should be measured using a bushel”. ④ “False”. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Shen nong ben cao ming li 神農本草名例 , “On the names in Shen nong’s Materia Medica”: 名實既虛，寒溫多謬 , “The associations of names and substances are false ; [statements on] the cold and warm [nature of substances] are wrong”.
